ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription:
I had moments of losing track of what
was going on. I "blanked out" or "space d
out" or in some way felt that I was not
 part of what was going on.

I found that I was on "automatic pilot". I
 ended up doing things that I later realized 
I hadn't actively decided to do.

My sense of time changed. Things
 seemed to be happening in slow motion.

What was happening seemed unreal to
 me, like I was in a dream, or watching a 
movie or play.
I felt as though I were spectator watching what was happening to me, as if I were floating above the scene or observing it? as an outsider

There were moments when my sense of  my own body seemed distorted or changed. I felt disconnected from my own
body, or it was unusually large or small.

I felt as though things that were actually
 happening to others were happening to 
me  like I was in danger when I really
wasn't.

I was surprised to find afterwards that a 
lot of things happened at the time that I
was nor aware of, especially things I 
ordinarily would have noticed

I felt confused; That is, there were 
moments when I had difficulty making 
sense of what was happening.

I felt disoriented; that is, there were
 moments when I felt uncertain about
 where I was or what time it was.
I felt helpless to do more
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I felt sadness and grief
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription:
I felt frustrated or angry I could not do 
more
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I felt afraid for my own safety.
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I felt guilt that more was not done
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I felt ashamed of my emotional reactions
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I felt worried about the safety of others
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription:
I had the feeling I was about to lose 
control of my emotions
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription:
I had difficulty controlling my bowel 
and bladder.
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I was horrified by what happened
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription:
I had physical reactions like sweating, 
shaking, and pounding heart
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I felt I might pass out.
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: I thought I might die.
Notes: 0= Not at all true; 1= Slightly true; 2 = Somewhat true; 3 = Very true; 4 = Extremely true

ElementDescription: PDI total score
Notes: 999=Missing

ElementDescription: Time Point
Notes: 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Site
Notes: Study Site

ElementDescription: PDI Score indicative of significant distress [SIGNIFICANT] [1=Yes]
Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: Peritraumatic Distress Inventory: Feel Guilty
Notes: 1=None of the time; 2=A little of the time; 3=Some of the time; 4=Most of the time; 5=All or almost all of the time; -8=DON'T KNOW; -7=REFUSED

ElementDescription: Peritraumatic Distress Inventory: Feel Ashamed
Notes: 1=None of the time; 2=A little of the time; 3=Some of the time; 4=Most of the time; 5=All or almost all of the time; -8=DON'T KNOW; -7=REFUSED

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
Form used/assessment name
PDI: Sum of all items on scale; fully imputed using Freeze 1B cohort
Notes: 0 = No symptoms; 42 = Most severe symptoms

ElementDescription: PDI: Might Die
Notes: 0=None of the time; 1=A little of the time; 2=Some of the time; 3=Most of the time; 4=All or almost all of the time; -8=DON''T KNOW; -7=REFUSED; -5=Presented, not answered

ElementDescription: PDI: Feel Guilty (2 weeks)
Notes: 1=None of the time; 2=A little of the time; 3=Some of the time; 4=Most of the time; 5=All or almost all of the time; -8=DON''T KNOW; -7=REFUSED; -5=Presented, not answered

ElementDescription: PDI: Feel Ashamed (2 weeks)
Notes: 1=None of the time; 2=A little of the time; 3=Some of the time; 4=Most of the time; 5=All or almost all of the time; -8=DON''T KNOW; -7=REFUSED; -5=Presented, not answered

ElementDescription: PDI: Sum of all items on scale
Notes: 0=No symptoms; 42=Most severe symptoms

ElementDescription: PROMIS/PDI Guilt Shame Raw Score
Notes: Higher scores indicate higher levels of guilt/shame

ElementDescription: PDI - Peritraumatic Distress Inventory - Severe peritraumatic distress indicator, raw score greater than 9
Notes: 0 = False; 1 = True
